Class View

java.lang.Object
View
public class View
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the GUI section of the application. It currently holds all the relevant elements to create and run the GUI.

  • Constructor Details

    • View

      public View​(Controller controller)
      Creates a View-object with a specified Controller-object and initializes the jCheckBoxArrayList.
      Parameters:
      controller - The specified Controller-object which controls the program.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run​(java.util.ArrayList<Media> media, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> genreList)
      Runs the login screen GUI of the streaming service. At the moment only checks if the username and password both equals "admin", and if true, closes the login-screen frame and calls runStreamingService().
      Parameters:
      genreList - An ArrayList of all genres of the media.
      media - An ArrayList of Media objects.

    • runStreamingService

      public void runStreamingService​(java.util.ArrayList<Media> media, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> genreList)
      Creates the GUI of the streaming service. Uses the genreList to create an appropriate number of JCheckBoxes, which calls methods in the Controller-object. Also calls the update method to create the BorderLayout.CENTER panel with the media variable.
      Parameters:
      genreList - An ArrayList of all genres of the media.
      media - An ArrayList of Media objects.

    • getJCheckBoxArrayList

      public java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JCheckBox> getJCheckBoxArrayList()
      Returns the current ArrayList of JCheckBoxes.

    • getSearchField

      public java.lang.String getSearchField()
      Returns the String of text in the searchField.

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.ArrayList<Media> media)
      Creates and/or updates the current BorderLayout.CENTER panel by creating media panels (in code: gridPanel) for each of the Media objects given by the media parameter. A media panel is created with information from the get-methods from the Media-class, loading the medias BufferedImage field as a JButton. The JButton is then given the actionPerformed method of creating and displaying a new frame with a play-button, other relevant buttons, and information about the specific media.
      Parameters:
      media - An ArrayList of Media objects.

    • displayNoSuchMovieException

      public void displayNoSuchMovieException​(NoSuchMediaException ex)
      Creates and displays a messageDialog in case of failed search.
